trans-unit.source: Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline
trans-unit.target: Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create custom activities and use them in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create custom activities and use them in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline
trans-unit.target: Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory supports built-in activities such as Copy Activity and HDInsight Activity to be used in pipelines to move and process data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory supports built-in activities such as Copy Activity and HDInsight Activity to be used in pipelines to move and process data.

trans-unit.source: You can also create a custom .NET activity with your own transformation/processing logic and use the activity in a pipeline.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a custom .NET activity with your own transformation/processing logic and use the activity in a pipeline.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the activity to run using either an Azure HDInsight cluster or an Azure Batch service.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the activity to run using either an Azure HDInsight cluster or an Azure Batch service.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to create a custom activity and use it in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to create a custom activity and use it in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.

trans-unit.source: It also provides a detailed walkthrough with step-by-step instructions for creating and using a custom activity.
trans-unit.target: It also provides a detailed walkthrough with step-by-step instructions for creating and using a custom activity.

trans-unit.source: The walkthrough uses the HDInsight linked service.
trans-unit.target: The walkthrough uses the HDInsight linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use the Azure Batch linked service instead, you create a linked service of type AzureBatch and use it in the activity section of the pipeline JSON (linkedServiceName).
trans-unit.target: To use the Azure Batch linked service instead, you create a linked service of type AzureBatch and use it in the activity section of the pipeline JSON (linkedServiceName).

trans-unit.source: See the <link><linkText>Azure Batch Linked Service</linkText><title></title></link> section for details on using Azure Batch with the custom activity.
trans-unit.target: See the <link><linkText>Azure Batch Linked Service</linkText><title></title></link> section for details on using Azure Batch with the custom activity.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> Walkthrough
trans-unit.target: <html></html> Walkthrough

trans-unit.source: This Walkthrough provides you with step-by-step instructions for creating a custom activity and using the activity in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: This Walkthrough provides you with step-by-step instructions for creating a custom activity and using the activity in an Azure Data Factory pipeline.

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough extends the tutorial from the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough extends the tutorial from the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to see the custom activity working, you need to go through the Get started tutorial first and then do this walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: If you want to see the custom activity working, you need to go through the Get started tutorial first and then do this walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Tutorial from <link><linkText>Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Tutorial from <link><linkText>Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You must complete the tutorial from this article before doing this walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: You must complete the tutorial from this article before doing this walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013

trans-unit.source: Download and install <link><linkText>Azure .NET SDK[azure-developer-center]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Download and install <link><linkText>Azure .NET SDK[azure-developer-center]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Download the latest <link><linkText>NuGet package for Azure Data Factory</linkText><title></title></link> and Install it.
trans-unit.target: Download the latest <link><linkText>NuGet package for Azure Data Factory</linkText><title></title></link> and Install it.

trans-unit.source: Instructions are in the walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: Instructions are in the walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: Download and install NuGet package for Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Download and install NuGet package for Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Instructions are in the walkthrough, so you can skip this step.
trans-unit.target: Instructions are in the walkthrough, so you can skip this step.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a custom activity
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a custom activity

trans-unit.source: Create a .NET Class Library project.
trans-unit.target: Create a .NET Class Library project.

trans-unit.source: Launch
trans-unit.target: Launch

trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.target: Click

trans-unit.target: File

trans-unit.target: , point to

trans-unit.target: New

trans-unit.target: , and click

trans-unit.target: Project

trans-unit.source: Expand
trans-unit.target: Expand

trans-unit.source: Templates
trans-unit.target: Templates

trans-unit.source: , and select
trans-unit.target: , and select

trans-unit.source: Visual C#
trans-unit.target: Visual C#

trans-unit.source: . In this walkthrough, you use C#, but you can use any .NET language to develop the custom activity.
trans-unit.target: . In this walkthrough, you use C#, but you can use any .NET language to develop the custom activity.

trans-unit.source: Select
trans-unit.target: Select

trans-unit.target: Class Library

trans-unit.source: from the list of project types on the right.
trans-unit.target: from the list of project types on the right.

trans-unit.source: Enter
trans-unit.target: Enter

trans-unit.source: MyDotNetActivity
trans-unit.target: MyDotNetActivity

trans-unit.source: for the
trans-unit.target: for the

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Select
trans-unit.target: Select

trans-unit.source: C:\ADFGetStarted
trans-unit.target: C:\ADFGetStarted

trans-unit.source: for the
trans-unit.target: for the

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Click
trans-unit.target: Click

trans-unit.target: OK

trans-unit.source: to create the project.
trans-unit.target: to create the project.

trans-unit.source: Click <html></html>Tools<html></html>, point to <html></html>NuGet Package Manager<html></html>, and click <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Click <html></html>Tools<html></html>, point to <html></html>NuGet Package Manager<html></html>, and click <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: In the <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>, execute the following command to import <html></html>Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: In the <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>, execute the following command to import <html></html>Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Import the Azure Storage NuGet package in to the project.
trans-unit.target: Import the Azure Storage NuGet package in to the project.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to the source file in the project.
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to the source file in the project.

trans-unit.source: Change the name of the namespace to MyDotNetActivityNS.
trans-unit.target: Change the name of the namespace to MyDotNetActivityNS.

trans-unit.source: Change the name of the class to MyDotNetActivity and derive it from the IDotNetActivity interface as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Change the name of the class to MyDotNetActivity and derive it from the IDotNetActivity interface as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Implement (Add) the Execute method of the IDotNetActivity interface to the MyDotNetActivity class and copy the following sample code to the method.
trans-unit.target: Implement (Add) the Execute method of the IDotNetActivity interface to the MyDotNetActivity class and copy the following sample code to the method.

trans-unit.source: The following sample code counts the number of lines in the input blob and produces the following content in the output blob: path to the blob, number of lines in the blob, the machine on which the activity ran, current date-time.
trans-unit.target: The following sample code counts the number of lines in the input blob and produces the following content in the output blob: path to the blob, number of lines in the blob, the machine on which the activity ran, current date-time.

trans-unit.source: Add the following helper methods.
trans-unit.target: Add the following helper methods.

trans-unit.source: The Execute method invokes these helper methods.
trans-unit.target: The Execute method invokes these helper methods.

trans-unit.source: The GetConnectionString method retrieves the Azure Storage connection string and the GetFolderPath method retrieves the blob location.
trans-unit.target: The GetConnectionString method retrieves the Azure Storage connection string and the GetFolderPath method retrieves the blob location.

trans-unit.source: Compile the project.
trans-unit.target: Compile the project.

trans-unit.source: Click Build from the menu and click Build Solution.
trans-unit.target: Click Build from the menu and click Build Solution.

trans-unit.source: Launch Windows Explorer, and navigate to bin\debug or bin\release folder depending type of build.
trans-unit.target: Launch Windows Explorer, and navigate to bin\debug or bin\release folder depending type of build.

trans-unit.source: Create a zip file MyDotNetActivity.zip that contain all the binaries in the \bin\Debug folder. You may want to include the MyDotNetActivity.pdb file so that you get additional details such as line number in the source code that caused the issue in case of a failure.
trans-unit.target: Create a zip file MyDotNetActivity.zip that contain all the binaries in the \bin\Debug folder. You may want to include the MyDotNetActivity.pdb file so that you get additional details such as line number in the source code that caused the issue in case of a failure.

trans-unit.source: Upload MyDotNetActivity.zip as a blob to the blob container: customactvitycontainer in the Azure blob storage that the StorageLinkedService linked service in the ADFTutorialDataFactory uses.
trans-unit.target: Upload MyDotNetActivity.zip as a blob to the blob container: customactvitycontainer in the Azure blob storage that the StorageLinkedService linked service in the ADFTutorialDataFactory uses.

trans-unit.source: Create the blob container customactivitycontainer if it does not already exist.
trans-unit.target: Create the blob container customactivitycontainer if it does not already exist.

trans-unit.source: If you add this .NET activity project to a solution in Visual Studio that contains a Data Factory project, you do not need to perform the last two steps of creating the zip file and manually uploading it to the Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: If you add this .NET activity project to a solution in Visual Studio that contains a Data Factory project, you do not need to perform the last two steps of creating the zip file and manually uploading it to the Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: When you publish Data Factory entities using Visual Studio, these steps are automatically done by the publishing process.
trans-unit.target: When you publish Data Factory entities using Visual Studio, these steps are automatically done by the publishing process.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Build your first pipeline using Visual Studio</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Copy data from Azure Blob to Azure SQL</linkText><title></title></link> articles to learn about creating and publishing Data Factory entities using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Build your first pipeline using Visual Studio</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Copy data from Azure Blob to Azure SQL</linkText><title></title></link> articles to learn about creating and publishing Data Factory entities using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Use the custom activity in a pipeline
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Use the custom activity in a pipeline

trans-unit.source: Here are the steps you will be performing in this step:
trans-unit.target: Here are the steps you will be performing in this step:

trans-unit.source: Create a linked service for the HDInsight cluster on which the custom activity will run as a map-only job.
trans-unit.target: Create a linked service for the HDInsight cluster on which the custom activity will run as a map-only job.

trans-unit.source: Create an output table that the pipeline in this sample will produce.
trans-unit.target: Create an output table that the pipeline in this sample will produce.

trans-unit.source: Create and run a pipeline that uses the custom activity you created in step 1.
trans-unit.target: Create and run a pipeline that uses the custom activity you created in step 1.

trans-unit.source: Create a linked service for HDInsight cluster that will be used to run the custom activity
trans-unit.target: Create a linked service for HDInsight cluster that will be used to run the custom activity

trans-unit.source: The Azure Data Factory service supports creation of an on-demand cluster and use it to process input to produce output data.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Data Factory service supports creation of an on-demand cluster and use it to process input to produce output data.

trans-unit.source: You can also use your own cluster to perform the same.
trans-unit.target: You can also use your own cluster to perform the same.

trans-unit.source: When you use on-demand HDInsight cluster, a cluster gets created for each slice.
trans-unit.target: When you use on-demand HDInsight cluster, a cluster gets created for each slice.

trans-unit.source: Whereas, if you use your own HDInsight cluster, the cluster is ready to process the slice immediately.
trans-unit.target: Whereas, if you use your own HDInsight cluster, the cluster is ready to process the slice immediately.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, when you use on-demand cluster, you may not see the output data as quickly as when you use your own cluster.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, when you use on-demand cluster, you may not see the output data as quickly as when you use your own cluster.

trans-unit.source: At runtime, an instance of a .NET activity runs only on one worker node in the HDInsight cluster; it cannot be scaled to run on multiple nodes.
trans-unit.target: At runtime, an instance of a .NET activity runs only on one worker node in the HDInsight cluster; it cannot be scaled to run on multiple nodes.

trans-unit.source: Multiple instances of .NET activity can run in parallel on different nodes of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Multiple instances of .NET activity can run in parallel on different nodes of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you have extended the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial with the walkthrough from <link><linkText>Use Pig and Hive with Azure Data Factory[hivewalkthrough]</linkText><title></title></link>, you can skip creation of this linked service and use the linked service you already have in the ADFTutorialDataFactory.
trans-unit.target: If you have extended the <link><linkText>Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial with the walkthrough from <link><linkText>Use Pig and Hive with Azure Data Factory[hivewalkthrough]</linkText><title></title></link>, you can skip creation of this linked service and use the linked service you already have in the ADFTutorialDataFactory.

trans-unit.source: To use an on-demand HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: To use an on-demand HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Portal, click Author and Deploy in the Data Factory home page.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Portal, click Author and Deploy in the Data Factory home page.

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, click New compute from the command bar and select On-demand HDInsight cluster from the menu.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, click New compute from the command bar and select On-demand HDInsight cluster from the menu.

trans-unit.source: Do the following in the JSON script:
trans-unit.target: Do the following in the JSON script:

trans-unit.source: For the clusterSize property, specify the size of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the clusterSize property, specify the size of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the jobsContainer property, specify the name of the default container where the cluster logs will be stored.
trans-unit.target: For the jobsContainer property, specify the name of the default container where the cluster logs will be stored.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of this tutorial, specify adfjobscontainer.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of this tutorial, specify adfjobscontainer.

trans-unit.source: For the timeToLive property, specify how long the customer can be idle before it is deleted.
trans-unit.target: For the timeToLive property, specify how long the customer can be idle before it is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For the version property, specify the HDInsight version you want to use.
trans-unit.target: For the version property, specify the HDInsight version you want to use.

trans-unit.source: If you exclude this property, the latest version is used.
trans-unit.target: If you exclude this property, the latest version is used.

trans-unit.source: For the linkedServiceName, specify StorageLinkedService that you had created in the Get started tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For the linkedServiceName, specify StorageLinkedService that you had created in the Get started tutorial.

trans-unit.source: "name": "HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService",
trans-unit.target: "name": "HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService",

trans-unit.source: "properties": {
trans-unit.target: "properties": {

trans-unit.source: "type": "HDInsightOnDemand",
trans-unit.target: "type": "HDInsightOnDemand",

trans-unit.source: "typeProperties": {
trans-unit.target: "typeProperties": {

trans-unit.source: "clusterSize": "1",
trans-unit.target: "clusterSize": "1",

trans-unit.source: "timeToLive": "00:05:00",
trans-unit.target: "timeToLive": "00:05:00",

trans-unit.source: "version": "3.1",
trans-unit.target: "version": "3.1",

trans-unit.source: "linkedServiceName": "StorageLinkedService"
trans-unit.target: "linkedServiceName": "StorageLinkedService"

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use your own HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: To use your own HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Portal, click Author and Deploy in the Data Factory home page.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Portal, click Author and Deploy in the Data Factory home page.

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, click New compute from the command bar and select HDInsight cluster from the menu.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, click New compute from the command bar and select HDInsight cluster from the menu.

trans-unit.source: Do the following in the JSON script:
trans-unit.target: Do the following in the JSON script:

trans-unit.source: For the clusterUri property, enter the URL for your HDInsight. For example: https://.azurehdinsight.net/
trans-unit.target: For the clusterUri property, enter the URL for your HDInsight. For example: https://.azurehdinsight.net/

trans-unit.source: For the UserName property, enter the user name who has access to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the UserName property, enter the user name who has access to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the Password property, enter the password for the user.
trans-unit.target: For the Password property, enter the password for the user.

trans-unit.source: For the LinkedServiceName property, enter StorageLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: For the LinkedServiceName property, enter StorageLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: This is the linked service you had created in the Get started tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This is the linked service you had created in the Get started tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: Create an output table
trans-unit.target: Create an output table

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory editor, click New dataset, and then click Azure Blob storage from the command bar.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory editor, click New dataset, and then click Azure Blob storage from the command bar.

trans-unit.source: Replace the JSON script in the right pane with the following JSON script:
trans-unit.target: Replace the JSON script in the right pane with the following JSON script:

trans-unit.source: Output location is adftutorial/customactivityoutput/YYYYMMDDHH/ where YYYYMMDDHH is the year, month, date, and hour of the slice being produced.
trans-unit.target: Output location is adftutorial/customactivityoutput/YYYYMMDDHH/ where YYYYMMDDHH is the year, month, date, and hour of the slice being produced.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Developer Reference[adf-developer-reference]</linkText><title></title></link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Developer Reference[adf-developer-reference]</linkText><title></title></link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the table.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the table.

trans-unit.source: Create and run a pipeline that uses the custom activity
trans-unit.target: Create and run a pipeline that uses the custom activity

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, click New pipeline on the command bar.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, click New pipeline on the command bar.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see the command, click ... (Ellipsis) to see it.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see the command, click ... (Ellipsis) to see it.

trans-unit.source: Replace the JSON in the right pane with the following JSON script.
trans-unit.target: Replace the JSON in the right pane with the following JSON script.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use your own cluster and followed the steps to create the HDInsightLinkedService linked service, replace HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService with HDInsightLinkedService in the following JSON.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use your own cluster and followed the steps to create the HDInsightLinkedService linked service, replace HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService with HDInsightLinkedService in the following JSON.

trans-unit.source: Replace StartDateTime value with the three days prior to current day and EndDateTime value with the current day.
trans-unit.target: Replace StartDateTime value with the three days prior to current day and EndDateTime value with the current day.

trans-unit.source: Both StartDateTime and EndDateTime must be in <link><linkText>ISO format</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Both StartDateTime and EndDateTime must be in <link><linkText>ISO format</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The output table is scheduled to be produced every day, so there will be three slices produced.
trans-unit.target: The output table is scheduled to be produced every day, so there will be three slices produced.

trans-unit.source: Note the following:
trans-unit.target: Note the following:

trans-unit.source: There is one activity in the activities section and it is of type: DotNetActivity.
trans-unit.target: There is one activity in the activities section and it is of type: DotNetActivity.

trans-unit.source: Use the same input table EmpTableFromBlob that you used in the Get started tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Use the same input table EmpTableFromBlob that you used in the Get started tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Use a new output table OutputTableForCustom that you will create in the next step.
trans-unit.target: Use a new output table OutputTableForCustom that you will create in the next step.

trans-unit.source: AssemblyName is set to the name of the DLL: MyActivities.dll.
trans-unit.target: AssemblyName is set to the name of the DLL: MyActivities.dll.

trans-unit.source: EntryPoint is set to MyDotNetActivityNS.MyDotNetActivity.
trans-unit.target: EntryPoint is set to MyDotNetActivityNS.MyDotNetActivity.

trans-unit.source: PackageLinkedService is set to MyBlobStore that was created as part of the tutorial from Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted].
trans-unit.target: PackageLinkedService is set to MyBlobStore that was created as part of the tutorial from Get started with Azure Data Factory[adfgetstarted].

trans-unit.source: This blob store contains the custom activity zip file.
trans-unit.target: This blob store contains the custom activity zip file.

trans-unit.source: PackageFile is set to customactivitycontainer/MyDotNetActivity.zip.
trans-unit.target: PackageFile is set to customactivitycontainer/MyDotNetActivity.zip.

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the output files are generated in the blob storage in the adftutorial container.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the output files are generated in the blob storage in the adftutorial container.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>output from custom activity</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>output from custom activity</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you open the output file, you should see the output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: If you open the output file, you should see the output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: adftutorial/,emp.txt,2,WORKERNODE0,03/27/2015 19:23:28
trans-unit.target: adftutorial/,emp.txt,2,WORKERNODE0,03/27/2015 19:23:28

trans-unit.source: (blob location), (name of the blob), (number of lines in the blob), (node on which the activity ran), (date time stamp)
trans-unit.target: (blob location), (name of the blob), (number of lines in the blob), (node on which the activity ran), (date time stamp)

trans-unit.source: Use the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[azure-preview-portal]</linkText><title></title></link> or Azure PowerShell cmdlets to monitor your data factory, pipelines, and data sets.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[azure-preview-portal]</linkText><title></title></link> or Azure PowerShell cmdlets to monitor your data factory, pipelines, and data sets.

trans-unit.source: You can see messages from the ActivityLogger in the code for the custom activity in the logs (specifically user-0.log) that you can download from the portal or using cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: You can see messages from the ActivityLogger in the code for the custom activity in the logs (specifically user-0.log) that you can download from the portal or using cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>download logs from custom activity</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>download logs from custom activity</linkText>

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Monitor and Manage Pipelines</linkText><title></title></link> for detailed steps for monitoring datasets and pipelines.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Monitor and Manage Pipelines</linkText><title></title></link> for detailed steps for monitoring datasets and pipelines.

trans-unit.source: Updating a custom activity
trans-unit.target: Updating a custom activity

trans-unit.source: If you update the code for the custom activity, build it, and upload the zip file that contains new binaries to the blob storage.
trans-unit.target: If you update the code for the custom activity, build it, and upload the zip file that contains new binaries to the blob storage.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Using Azure Batch linked service
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Using Azure Batch linked service

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Technical Overview[batch-technical-overview]</linkText><title></title></link> for an overview of the Azure Batch service and see <link><linkText>Getting Started with the Azure Batch Library for .NET[batch-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link> to quickly get started with the Azure Batch service.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Technical Overview[batch-technical-overview]</linkText><title></title></link> for an overview of the Azure Batch service and see <link><linkText>Getting Started with the Azure Batch Library for .NET[batch-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link> to quickly get started with the Azure Batch service.

trans-unit.source: You can run your custom .NET activities using Azure Batch as a compute resource.
trans-unit.target: You can run your custom .NET activities using Azure Batch as a compute resource.

trans-unit.source: You will have to create your own Azure Batch pools and specify the number of VMs along with other configurations.
trans-unit.target: You will have to create your own Azure Batch pools and specify the number of VMs along with other configurations.

trans-unit.source: Azure Batch pools provides the following features to customers:
trans-unit.target: Azure Batch pools provides the following features to customers:

trans-unit.source: Create pools containing a single core to thousands of cores.
trans-unit.target: Create pools containing a single core to thousands of cores.

trans-unit.source: Auto scale VM count based on a formula
trans-unit.target: Auto scale VM count based on a formula

trans-unit.source: Support VMs of any size
trans-unit.target: Support VMs of any size

trans-unit.source: Configurable number of tasks per VM
trans-unit.target: Configurable number of tasks per VM

trans-unit.source: Queue unlimited number of tasks
trans-unit.target: Queue unlimited number of tasks

trans-unit.source: Here are the high-level steps for using the Azure Batch Linked Service in the walkthrough described in the previous section:
trans-unit.target: Here are the high-level steps for using the Azure Batch Linked Service in the walkthrough described in the previous section:

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Batch account using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Batch account using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Technical Overview[batch-create-account]</linkText><title></title></link> article for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Technical Overview[batch-create-account]</linkText><title></title></link> article for instructions.

trans-unit.source: Note down the Azure Batch account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: Note down the Azure Batch account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <link><linkText>New-AzureBatchAccount[new-azure-batch-account]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch account.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <link><linkText>New-AzureBatchAccount[new-azure-batch-account]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch account.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Using Azure PowerShell to Manage Azure Batch Account[azure-batch-blog]</linkText><title></title></link> for detailed instructions on using this cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Using Azure PowerShell to Manage Azure Batch Account[azure-batch-blog]</linkText><title></title></link> for detailed instructions on using this cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Batch pool.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Batch pool.

trans-unit.source: You can download the source code for the <link><linkText>Azure Batch Explorer tool[batch-explorer]</linkText><title></title></link>, compile, and use it (or) use <link><linkText>Azure Batch Library for .NET[batch-net-library]</linkText><title></title></link> to create a Azure Batch pool.
trans-unit.target: You can download the source code for the <link><linkText>Azure Batch Explorer tool[batch-explorer]</linkText><title></title></link>, compile, and use it (or) use <link><linkText>Azure Batch Library for .NET[batch-net-library]</linkText><title></title></link> to create a Azure Batch pool.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Explorer Sample Walkthrough[batch-explorer-walkthrough]</linkText><title></title></link> for step-by-step instructions for using the Azure Batch Explorer.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Explorer Sample Walkthrough[batch-explorer-walkthrough]</linkText><title></title></link> for step-by-step instructions for using the Azure Batch Explorer.

trans-unit.source: You can also use <link><linkText>New-AzureBatchPool[new-azure-batch-pool]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch pool.
trans-unit.target: You can also use <link><linkText>New-AzureBatchPool[new-azure-batch-pool]</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch pool.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Batch Linked Service using the following JSON template.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Batch Linked Service using the following JSON template.

trans-unit.source: The Data Factory Editor displays a similar template for you to start with.
trans-unit.target: The Data Factory Editor displays a similar template for you to start with.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Azure Batch account name, account key and pool name in the JSON snippet.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Azure Batch account name, account key and pool name in the JSON snippet.

trans-unit.source: Append "." to the name of your batch account for the accountName property. Example: "mybatchaccount.eastus". Another option is to provide the batchUri endpoint as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Append "." to the name of your batch account for the accountName property. Example: "mybatchaccount.eastus". Another option is to provide the batchUri endpoint as shown below.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Linked Service MSDN topic</linkText><title></title></link> for descriptions of these properties.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Azure Batch Linked Service MSDN topic</linkText><title></title></link> for descriptions of these properties.

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, open JSON definition for the pipeline you created in the walkthrough and replace HDInsightLinkedService with AzureBatchLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, open JSON definition for the pipeline you created in the walkthrough and replace HDInsightLinkedService with AzureBatchLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: You may want to change the start and end times for the pipeline so that you can test the scenario with the Azure Batch service.
trans-unit.target: You may want to change the start and end times for the pipeline so that you can test the scenario with the Azure Batch service.

trans-unit.source: You can see the Azure Batch tasks associated with processing the slices in the Azure Batch Explorer as shown in the following diagram.
trans-unit.target: You can see the Azure Batch tasks associated with processing the slices in the Azure Batch Explorer as shown in the following diagram.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Batch tasks</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Batch tasks</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Data Factory service does not support an on-demand option for Azure Batch as it does for HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The Data Factory service does not support an on-demand option for Azure Batch as it does for HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: You can only use your own Azure Batch pool in an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You can only use your own Azure Batch pool in an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Azure Data Factory Updates: Execute ADF Custom .NET activities using Azure Batch</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Azure Data Factory Updates: Execute ADF Custom .NET activities using Azure Batch</linkText><title></title></link>.
